description: INSTALLATION OF EXTERNAL INSULATION TO  ELEVATIONS WITH SILICON RENDER FINISH.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Except as required by Condition 3, the development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Block / Site Plan; Existing and Proposed Photomontage (superimposed photos); External Wall Insulation and Render Finish - sample received by Council 08 Nov 2019.

Condition : 3 - Notwithstanding Condition 2, this permission is confined to the installation of external wall insulation with render finish, alongside replacement window cills and the replacement of single glazed windows for double glazed units to fit the existing window openings. No other works form part of this permission. 
Reason:  To ensure a satisfactory appearance of the development and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.6 of the London Plan 2016, policy CS14 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM D2 and D3 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 4 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application. Specifically, the external wall insulation with render finish shall match the sample panel received by the Council on 08 Nov 2019, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 5 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:
   i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   ii) The application was approved without delay.
